<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/84cf6bd81bec93b49166cd48fccc7087fdbaa6fc|patch 8.2.0988: getting directory contents is always case sorted>
patch 8.2.0988: getting directory contents is always case sorted

Problem:    Getting directory contents is always case sorted.
Solution:   Add sort options and v:collate. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6229)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0988: getting directory contents is always case sorted · vim/vim@84cf6bd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0988: getting directory contents is always case sorted · vim/vim@84cf6bd
attachments.text: Problem: Getting directory contents is always case sorted. Solution: Add sort options and v:collate. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6229)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/a6e8bf2d8929ef52eeda495e0e0c3d2bff8f5830|patch 8.2.0989: crash after resizing a terminal window>
patch 8.2.0989: crash after resizing a terminal window

Problem:    Crash after resizing a terminal window. (August Masquelier)
Solution:   Add check for valid row in libvterm. (closes #6273)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0989: crash after resizing a terminal window · vim/vim@a6e8bf2
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0989: crash after resizing a terminal window · vim/vim@a6e8bf2
attachments.text: Problem: Crash after resizing a terminal window. (August Masquelier) Solution: Add check for valid row in libvterm. (closes #6273)

text:

patch 8.2.0990: Using duplicate error number

Problem:    Using duplicate error number.
Solution:   Use an unused error number.  Add a test for it.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0990: Using duplicate error number · vim/vim@a1bc6f1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0990: Using duplicate error number · vim/vim@a1bc6f1
attachments.text: Problem: Using duplicate error number. Solution: Use an unused error number. Add a test for it.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0fe937fd8616fcd24b1b1ef2ab9f1657615dd22c|patch 8.2.0991: cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window>
patch 8.2.0991: cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window

Problem:    Cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window.
Solution:   Add types to win_gettype(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6277)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0991: cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window · vim/vim@0fe937f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0991: cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window · vim/vim@0fe937f
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot get window type for autocmd and preview window. Solution: Add types to win_gettype(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6277)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/101f4810e27e432970bc8809e18f018e1795937f|patch 8.2.0992: Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command>
patch 8.2.0992: Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command

Problem:    Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command.
Solution:   Give an error when using :import outside of a script.
            (closes #6271)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0992: Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command · vim/vim@101f481
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0992: Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command · vim/vim@101f481
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when using :import in the Vim command. Solution: Give an error when using :import outside of a script. (closes #6271)

patch 8.2.0993: Vim9 script test fails with normal features

Problem:    Vim9 script test fails with normal features.
Solution:   Use :func instead of :def for now.
